title: Party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety

questions.title: Is your country a Party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (CPB)?
If your country is not a Party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (CPB), is there any national process in place towards becoming a Party?
Here you may provide further details
Has your country introduced the necessary national measures for the implementation of the Protocol?

options.title: National measures are fully in place
National measures are partially in place
Only temporary measures have been introduced
No measures have yet been taken

questions.title: Which specific instruments are in place for the implementation of national biosafety measures?

options.title: One or more national biosafety laws
One or more national biosafety regulations
One or more sets of biosafety guidelines
Other laws, regulations or guidelines that indirectly apply to biosafety

questions.title: Has your country undertaken initiatives to mainstream biosafety into national biodiversity strategies and action plans, other policies, or legislation?
Has your country established a mechanism for budget allocations for the operation of its national biosafety measures?
Does your country have permanent staff to administer functions directly related to biosafety?
If you answered Yes to question 18, how many permanent staff members are in place whose functions are directly related to  biosafety ?
Is this number adequate
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 2 in your country
Does your country regulate the transboundary movement, handling or use of living modified organisms (LMOs) which are pharmaceuticals to humans?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 5 in your country:
Does your country regulate the transit of LMOs?
Does your country regulate the contained use of LMOs?
Has your country taken a decision concerning the import of LMOs for contained use?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 6 in your country:

title: Articles 7 to 10 – Advance Informed Agreement (AIA) and intentional introduction of LMOs into the environment

questions.title: Has your country established legal requirements for exporters under its jurisdiction to notify in writing the competent national authority of the Party of import prior to the intentional transboundary movement of an LMO that falls within the scope of the AIA procedure?
When acting as the Party of export, has your country established legal requirements for the accuracy of information contained in the notification provided by the exporter?

options.title: Not applicable (Party currently not exporting LMOs)

questions.title: In the current reporting period, has your country received a notification regarding intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
If you answered Yes to question 29, did the notification(s) contain complete information (at a minimum the information specified in Annex I to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety)?
If you answered Yes to question 29, has your country acknowledged receipt of the notification(s) to the notifier within ninety days of receipt?
If you answered Yes to question 29, has your country informed of its decision(s)
The notifier?
The Biosafety Clearing-House (BCH)?

In the current reporting period, has your country taken a decision in response to the notification(s) regarding intentional transboundary movements of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment?
If you answered Yes to question 33, how many LMOs has your country approved for import for intentional introduction into the environment?
If you answered under question 34 that LMOs were approved, have all these LMOs actually been imported into your country?
If you answered under question 34 that LMOs were approved, have all these LMOs actually been imported into your country?

options.title: Approval of the import/use of the LMO(s) without conditions
Approval of the import/use of the LMO(s) with conditions
Prohibition of the import/use of the LMO(s)
Inform the notifier that the period for communicating the decision has been extended

questions.title: If you answered under question 36 that your country has taken a decision to approve the import with conditions or to prohibit the import, were the reasons provided?

Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Articles 7 to 10 in your country, including measures in case of lack of scientific certainty on potential adverse effects of LMOs for intentional introduction to the environment

title: Article 11 – Procedure for living modified organisms intended for direct use as food or feed, or for processing (LMOs-FFP)

questions.title: Does your country have law(s), regulation(s) or administrative measures for decision-making regarding domestic use, including placing on the market, of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movement for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?

Has your country established legal requirements for the accuracy of information to be provided by the applicant regarding the domestic use, including placing on the market, of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movement for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
Has your country established a mechanism to ensure that decisions regarding LMOs-FFP that may be subject to transboundary movement will be communicated to the Parties through the BCH?
Does your country have law(s), regulation(s) or administrative measures for decision-making regarding the import of LMOs for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
In the current reporting period, how many decisions has your country taken regarding the import of LMOs for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?

Has your country established a mechanism for the review and change of a decision regarding an intentional transboundary movement of LMOs?

If you answered Yes to question 46, were any of the reviews triggered by a request from the Party of export or the notifier?
If you answered Yes to question 48, did your country provide a response within ninety days setting out the reasons for the decision?
If you answered Yes to question 46, were any of the reviews initiated by your country as the Party of import?

The notifier
The BCH?

title: Article 14 – Bilateral, regional and multilateral agreements and arrangements

questions.title: How many bilateral, regional or multilateral agreements or arrangements relevant to biosafety has your country established with other Parties/non-Parties?
If you answered under question 58 that agreements or arrangements were established, please provide a brief description of their scope and objective
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 14 in your country

title: Articles 15 & 16 – Risk Assessment and Risk Management

questions.title: Does the domestic regulatory framework of your country require risk assessments of LMOs to be conducted?
If you answered Yes to question 61, with regard to which LMOs does the requirement apply (select all that apply)?

options.title: For imports of LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment
For imports of LMOs intended for direct use as food or feed, or for processing
For decisions regarding domestic use, including placing on the market, of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movements for direct use as food or feed, or for processing
For imports of LMOs for contained use

questions.title: Has your country established a mechanism to conduct risk assessments prior to taking decisions regarding LMOs?
If you answered Yes to question 63, does the mechanism include procedures to identify and/or train national experts to conduct risk assessments?
Capacity-building in risk assessment or risk management
How many people in your country have been trained in risk assessment, monitoring, management and control of LMOs?
Risk assessment:
Is this number adequate
Risk management
Is this number adequate
Monitoring:
Is this number adequate
Is your country using training material and/or technical guidance for training in risk assessment and risk management of LMOs?
If you answered Yes to question 66, is your country using the “Manual on Risk Assessment of LMOs” (developed by the CBD Secretariat) for training in risk assessment?

If you answered Yes to question 66, is your country using the “Guidance on Risk Assessment of LMOs” (developed by the Online Forum and the AHTEG on Risk Assessment and Risk Management) for training in risk assessment?
Does your country have specific needs for further guidance on specific topics of risk assessment of LMOs?

Does your country have the capacity to detect, identify, assess and/or monitor living modified organisms or specific traits that may have adverse effects on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity, taking into account risks to human health?
Detect:
Identify:
Assess:
Monitor:
Conducting risk assessment or risk management
Has your country adopted or used any guidance documents for the purpose of conducting risk assessment or risk management, or for evaluating risk assessment reports submitted by notifiers?
Risk assessment:
Risk management:

If you answered Yes to question 71, is your country using the “Guidance on Risk Assessment of LMOs” (developed by the Online Forum and the AHTEG on Risk Assessment and Risk Management) for conducting  risk assessment or risk management, or for evaluating risk assessment reports submitted by notifiers?
Has your country adopted any common approaches to risk assessment with other countries?
Has your country cooperated with other Parties with a view to identifying LMOs or specific traits that may have adverse effects on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity?

In the current reporting period, has your country conducted any kind of risk assessment of LMOs, including for contained use, field trials, commercial purposes, direct use as food, feed, or for processing?
If you answered Yes to question 75, how many risk assessments were conducted?
If you answered Yes to question 75, please indicate the scope of the risk assessments (select all that apply):

options.title: LMOs for contained use (in accordance with Article 3)
LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment for experimental testing or field trials
LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment for commercial purposes
LMOs for direct use as food
LMOs for direct use as feed

questions.title: If you answered Yes to question 75, were risk assessments conducted for all decisions taken on LMOs for intentional introduction into the environment or on domestic use of LMOs that may be subject to transboundary movement for direct use as food or feed, or for processing?
Has your country established appropriate mechanisms, measures and strategies to regulate and manage risks identified in the risk assessment of LMOs?

Has your country taken appropriate measures to prevent unintentional transboundary movements of LMOs, including such measures as requiring a risk assessment to be carried out prior to the first release of a LMO?

Has your country taken measures to ensure that any LMO, whether imported or locally developed, undergoes an appropriate period of observation that is commensurate with its life-cycle or generation time before it is put to its intended use?
Has your country established a mechanism for monitoring potential effects of LMOs released into the environment?
Does your country have the infrastructure (e.g. laboratory facilities) for monitoring or managing LMOs?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Articles 15 and 16 in your country

title: Article 17 – Unintentional transboundary movements and emergency measures

questions.title: Has your country established measures to notify affected or potentially affected States, the Biosafety Clearing-House and, where appropriate, relevant international organizations in case of a release under its jurisdiction that leads, or may lead, to an unintentional transboundary movement?
In the current reporting period, how many releases of LMOs occurred under your country’s jurisdiction that led, or may have led, to an unintentional transboundary movement?

If you answered under question 86 that a release occurred, has your country notified affected or potentially affected States, the Biosafety Clearing-House and, where appropriate, relevant international organizations?
Does your country have the capacity to take appropriate response measures in response to unintentional transboundary movements?
In the current reporting period, how many times has your country become aware of an unintentional transboundary movement into its territory?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 17 in your country

title: Article 18 – Handling, transport, packaging and identification

questions.title: Has your country taken measures to require that LMOs that are subject to transboundary movement are handled, packaged and transported under conditions of safety, taking into account relevant international rules and standards?

Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs-FFP, in cases where the identity of the LMOs is not known, clearly identifies that they may contain LMOs and are not intended for intentional introduction into the environment, as well as a contact point for further information?

Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs-FFP, in cases where the identity of the LMOs is known, clearly identifies that they contain LMOs and are not intended for intentional introduction into the environment, as well as a contact point for further information?
If you answered Yes to question(s) 91, 92 and/or 93, what type of documentation accompanying LMOs does your country require?

options.title: As part of other documentation (not specific for LMOs)

questions.title: Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs that are destined for contained use clearly identifies them as LMOs and specifies any requirements for the safe handling, storage, transport and use, the contact point for further information, including the name and address of the individual and institution to whom the LMO are consigned?
If you answered Yes to question 95, what type of documentation does your country require for the identification of LMOs that are destined for contained use?

options.title: As part of other documentation (not specific for LMOs)

questions.title: Has your country taken measures to require that documentation accompanying LMOs that are intended for intentional introduction into the environment of the Party of import, clearly identifies them as living modified organisms; specifies the identity and relevant traits and/or characteristics, any requirements for the safe handling, storage, transport and use, the contact point for further information and, as appropriate, the name and address of the importer and exporter; and contains a declaration that the movement is in conformity with the requirements of this Protocol applicable to the exporter?
If you answered Yes to question 97, what type of documentation does your country require for the identification of LMOs that are intended for intentional introduction into the environment?

options.title: As part of other documentation (not specific for LMOs)

questions.title: Does your country have available any guidance for the purpose of ensuring the safe handling, transport, and packaging of living modified organisms?
Does your country have the capacity to enforce the requirements of identification and documentation of LMOs?
How many customs officers in your country have received training in the identification of LMOs?
Is this number adequate
Has your country established procedures for the sampling and detection of LMOs?
How many laboratory personnel in your country have received training in detection of LMOs?
Does your country have reliable access to laboratory facilities for the detection of LMOs?
How many laboratories in your country are certified for LMO detection?
If you answered under question 105 that certified laboratories exist in your country, how many of them are currently operating in the detection of LMOs?
Here you may provide further details on the implementation of Article 18 in your country:

title: Article 19 – Competent National Authorities and National Focal Points

questions.title: In case your country has designated more than one competent national authority, has your country established a mechanism for the coordination of their actions prior to taking decisions regarding LMOs?

options.title: Not applicable (no competent national authority was designated)
Not applicable (only one competent national authority was designated)

questions.title: Has your country established adequate institutional capacity to enable the competent national authority(ies) to perform the administrative functions required by the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety?

title: Nagoya-Kuala Lumpur Supplementary Protocol on Liability and Redress

questions.title: Is your country a Party to the Nagoya-Kuala Lumpur Supplementary Protocol on Liability and Redress?
If you answered No to question 169, is there any national process in place towards becoming a Party to the Supplementary Protocol?
Has your country introduced the necessary measures for the implementation of the Supplementary Protocol?

options.title: National measures are fully in place
National measures are partially in place
Only temporary measures have been introduced
No measures have yet been taken

questions.title: Which instruments are in place for the implementation of the Supplementary Protocol?

options.title: One or more sets of guidelines

questions.title: Does your country have administrative or legal instruments that require response measures to be taken
In case of damage resulting from LMOs?
In case there is sufficient likelihood that damage will result if response measures are not taken?
If you answered Yes to question 173a, do these instruments impose requirements on an operator (select all that apply)?

options.title: Yes, the operator must inform the competent authority of the damage
Yes, the operator must evaluate the damage
Yes, the operator must take response measures

questions.title: If you answered Yes to question 173a, do these instruments require the operator to take response measures to avoid damage?
If you answered Yes to question 173a or 173b, do these instruments provide for a definition of “operator”?
If you answered Yes to question 176, which of the following could be an ‘operator’ (select all that apply)?

options.title: Person who placed the LMO on the market

questions.title: Has a competent authority been identified for carrying out the functions set out in the Supplementary Protocol?
If you answered Yes to question 178, what measures may the competent authority take (select all that apply)?

options.title: Identify the operator that caused the damage
Determine response measures to be taken by operator
Recover costs and expenses of the evaluation of the damage and the implementation of any response measures from the operator

questions.title: Does your country have measures in place to provide for financial security for damage resulting from LMOs?
If you answered Yes to question 180, what type of financial security measures are in place (select all that apply)?

options.title: Requirement to provide evidence for secure source of funding

questions.title: Does your country have rules and procedures on civil liability that address damage resulting from LMOs, or has such damage been recognized in court rulings (select all that apply)?

options.title: Yes, in a civil liability instrument

questions.title: Have there been any occurrences of damage resulting from LMOs in your country?
